metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8944 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The ioresources_init function in kernel/resource.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.7, as used in Android before 2016-08-05 on Nexus 6 and 7 (2013)devices, uses weak permissions for /proc/iomem, which allows local users toobtain sensitive information by reading this file, aka Android internal bug28814213 and Qualcomm internal bug CR786116. NOTE: the permissions may beintentional in most non-Android contexts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-87.110
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1065-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1065.73
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1067-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1067.72
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1026.35
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1022-gke - 4.4.0-1022.22
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1022-gke - 4.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-87.110').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').

linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').

linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
